description: Jamaican authorities announced new timings for the island-wide curfew until November 1. From Thursday, October 8, to Sunday, October 18, a nightly curfew will continue between 20:00 and 05:00 (local time). There will be extended curfews for the Heroes' Weekend from Sunday, October 18, to Tuesday, October 20, whereby a curfew from 15:00 on Sunday to 08:00 on Monday, October 19, will be effective and from 15:00 on Monday through to 05:00 on Tuesday. A nightly curfew between 21:00-05:00 curfew will then continue from the same Tuesday, October 20, through to November 1. UPDATE: Jamaican authorities announced new timings for the island-wide curfew until November 1. The original curfew lasted from 8 pm to 6 am. From Thursday, October 8, to Sunday, October 18, a nightly curfew will continue between 20:00 and 05:00 (local time). There will be extended curfews for the Heroes' Weekend from Sunday, October 18, to Tuesday, October 20, whereby a curfew from 15:00 on Sunday to 08:00 on Monday, October 19, will be effective and from 15:00 on Monday through to 05:00 on Tuesday. A nightly curfew between 21:00-05:00 curfew will then continue from the same Tuesday, October 20, through to November 1

description:
Jamaica announced its newly revised measures, which apply to international travelers arriving on the island as of July 15, 2020. All inbound travelers are required to complete an online Travel Authorization application. Those who are approved are issued a travel certificate, which they must present during the airline check-in process in order to board their flight, as well as upon their arrival in Jamaica. Those coming from high-risk areas of the globe  must complete the questionnaire between 2-5 days prior to their intended arrival in Jamaica, and will receive approval or denial in the 48 hours following form submission. Travelers bound from high-risk regions are required to upload their negative COVID-19 PCR test results to receive Authorization certification. These must be no more than ten days old from the date that the sample was collected to the date of their arrival in Jamaica and must come from a College of American Pathologists (CAP) accredited lab. All visitors will still be screened when they arrive in Jamaica by undergoing non-invasive temperature checks, observation for symptoms and a brief interview with Health Officers.
Short-term business travelers entering the country  must submit a rapid-result swab test upon arrival at the airport  and must remain quarantined until their results become available. Those who pass health checks and test negative on swabs may proceed to enter the country, but must adhere to the ‘Stay in Zone’ order.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jamaica announced testing and quarantine protocols for 3 category-travellers including Jamaicans and non-nationals, Non-nationals visiting Jamaica for tourism and Non-nationals visiting Jamaica for business. The 3 categories will be subject to testing if assessed as high risk as assessed as high risk will have their sample taken and await their test result under quarantine at home or in a government facility or hotel/intended address or 'stay in zone'  until their test results are available. If tested negative, they will be under either a 'stay at home for returning residents' measure or be placed in quarantine at home for 14 days or at their intended hotel or under the 'stay in zone'  for non nationals visiting and non national on business, depending on the risk. If the results are positive, individuals will be isolated at their designated area for 14 days as determined by the health authorities depending on their category.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Jamaican government implemented a social and economic support program called the CARE Programme, which provides assistance to vulnerable individuals and small businesses through innovative and existing delivery channel. More specifically, the program provides:
1. compassionate grants to those who were unemployed or informally employed pre-pandemic;
2. temporary unemployment benefits to the previously employed who have been laid off or terminated since the pandemic; and
3. grants to the self-employed whose regular earnings have been disrupted in addition to grants to small businesses.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: Jamaica announced testing and quarantine protocols for 3 category-travellers including Jamaicans and non-nationals, Non-nationals visiting Jamaica for tourism and Non-nationals visiting Jamaica for business. The 3 categories will be subject to testing if assessed as high risk as assessed as high risk will have their sample taken and await their test result under quarantine at home or in a government facility or hotel/intended address or 'stay in zone'  until their test results are available. If tested negative, they will be under either a 'stay at home for returning residents' measure or be placed in quarantine at home for 14 days or at their intended hotel or under the 'stay in zone'  for non nationals visiting and non national on business, depending on the risk. If the results are positive, individuals will be isolated at their designated area as determined by the health authorities depending on their category.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Jamaican government recently announced that it will be allowing medical marijuana patients to make cannabis purchases online for pickup at “herb houses” as a means to combat the coronavirus pandemic. In a separate move last week, the Cannabis Licensing Authority, CLA, also established interim regulations for the import and export of cannabis products.

description: Jamaica is enforcing an obligation to wear masks a mask in public for everybody after April 21. UPDATE: The original Obligation to wear masks only targeted every person who has flu-like symptoms, a respiratory disease (or cares for such a person) diabetes, hypertension or is 65 years or older. The new Policy obligates everybody to wear a mask in public.
